thread.title: Lions Hand Cougars First PacWest Defeat
thread.title_full: Lions Hand Cougars First PacWest Defeat

author: Azusa Pacific University Athletics
title: Lions Hand Cougars First PacWest Defeat
text: Box Score 0 Azusa Pacific APU (8-2-3, 5-1-0) 2 Winner Vanguard VU (4-7-1, 2-4-0) Azusa Pacific APU (8-2-3, 5-1-0) 0 Final Oct. 22, 2025 2 Vanguard VU (4-7-1, 2-4-0) Winner Score By Periods Team 1 2 F Azusa Pacific APU 0 0 0 Vanguard VU 1 1 2 Game Recap: Women's Soccer | 10/22/2025 2:16:00 PM | Michaela Boyd Lions Hand Cougars First PacWest Defeat Azusa Pacific fell 2-0 to Vanguard on Wednesday afternoon, snapping its 11 game undefeated streak AZUSA, Calif. - Azusa Pacific saw its 11-game unbeaten streak come to an end Wednesday afternoon, falling 2-0 to Vanguard in Costa Mesa in its first PacWest loss of the season and first defeat since September 4. Vanguard struck early, scoring less than three minutes into the match to grab a quick lead. Despite the early setback, the Cougars settled in and began to create chances of its own. The Cougars fired six shots in the opening half, including looks from Madison Woodward, Mayilen Salazar, and Camila Hernandez, but each was denied by the Lions' goalkeeper. In the second half, the Cougars continued to push forward, generating another nine shots. However, a second Vanguard goal midway through the half put APU in a two-goal hole they couldn't climb out of. The Cougars outshot Vanguard 15–6 and held a 2–1 edge in corners but couldn't find the finishing touch in the attacking third. Up NextL With the loss, Azusa Pacific moves to 8–2–3 overall and 5–1 in PacWest play. The Cougars will look to bounce back when they return home Saturday to face crosstown rival Biola in the last Cornerstone Cup match between the two teams. Kickoff at the Cougar Soccer Complex is at 5:00 p.m. Print Friendly Version
